description.narrative: The project strengthens the unions in industry sectors in Mozambique by training 700 people in organizing and negotiation skills, as well as in labour legislation. The aim is to find ways to make use of the existing legislation and monitoring systems in th e promotion of decent working conditions. The membership of each union will increase by 15 %, and the participation of especially young members and those in precarious working relationships in union activity will be encouraged. The unions will negotiate ne w and better company level collective agreements, especially paying attention to young and female workers? situation.The working relationships become more and more insecure and only negotiation and advocacy work of stronger unions can prevent further weake ning of the conditions of workers.Now there are about 50 000 people in formal employment in the sectors represented by the Mozambican industry unions, but the number increases steadily with the new investments. Because of the project, the working condition s of these people will improve. The beneficiaries are workers in industry sectors and their stronger and more capable unions. The project will be implemented with the international industry sector organization IndustriALL and all its three Mozambican affil iates.
